title: It's a Warm Spring... When Can I start Planting?

tasks.task: Determine the best time to start planting spring mixes.
subtasks: Ensure air temperature prevents winter kill.
Use a thermometer (e.g., food thermometer) to measure soil temperature at a 2-inch depth.
Refer to online resources (e.g., GreenCast) for soil and air temperature forecasts.
Consider a 10-day forecast to check for hard freezes.
Adjust planting depth for certain crops (e.g., peas, oats) to protect from frost.
Delay planting of susceptible crops (e.g., cool season species) until soil reaches 40 degrees Fahrenheit.
